choices.A: By using contracts between endpoint groups that send traffic to the firewall using a shared policy
choices.B: Through a virtual machine (VM) monitor domain

discussion.content:
This is one of those purposly missleading questions.
"ON" PA FW you use PBR, but here is "TO" PA so I would go for A

Selected Answer: A
Cisco ACI uses contract to tie in external security appliances

Selected Answer: A
Answer A is correct. Cisco ACI is using descriptiv language via UI and API. Contracts can utilize Proxy ARP and PBR as techniques for traffic routing, but it isn't the way to configure.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/white-paper-c11-743951.html#Howcontractswork

questions.question_text: How is traffic directed to a Palo Alto Networks firewall integrated with Cisco ACI?

discussion.content:
Add route tables in the application VPC (in addition to the VPC local route) as follows:

 Route table with IGW edge association - Add route destined to ALB with target as GWLBE.
 Route table with ALB subnet association - Add route destined to 0.0.0.0/0 with target as GWLBE.
 Route table with GWLBE subnet association - Add route destined to 0.0.0.0/0 with target as IGW.

Selected Answer: CD
Carrect answers are C/D
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/vm-series/11-0/vm-series-deployment/set-up-the-vm-series-firewall-on-aws/vm-series-integration-with-gateway-load-balancer

choices.C: Route table with IGW edge association - Add route destined to ALB with target as GWLBE
choices.A: Route table with ALB subnet association - Add route destined to 0.0.0.0/0 with target as NAT Gateway
choices.B: Route table with ALB subnet association - Add route destined to 0.0.0.0/0 with target as IGW
choices.D: Route table with GWLBE subnet association - Add route destined to 0.0.0.0/0 with target as IGW

questions.question_text: What are the two appropriate routing settings required to deploy software firewall integration with Amazon Web Service (AWS) GWLB? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Answer is A & C 
In the Cloud NGFW tenant, you can author rulestacks if you're you assigned the LocalRuleStackAdmin or GlobalRulestackAdmin role

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-ngfw/aws/cloud-ngfw-on-aws/rules-and-rulestacks/create-a-rulestack#:~:text=In%20the%20Cloud%20NGFW%20tenant,the%20LocalRuleStackAdmin%20or%20GlobalRulestackAdmin%20role.

Selected Answer: AC
A & C: "In the Cloud NGFW tenant, you can author rulestacks if you're you assigned the LocalRuleStackAdmin or GlobalRulestackAdmin role."

[https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/cloud-ngfw/aws/cloud-ngfw-on-aws/rules-and-rulestacks/create-a-rulestack]

questions.question_text: A user must be assigned one of which two roles in order to create local rulestacks in the Cloud NGFW for AWS tenant? (Choose two.)
Which deployment method should a GCP administrator use to deploy a VM-Series firewall to secure east-west traffic between Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs)?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A segmentation gateway secures east-west traffic between virtual private clouds (VPCs) to ensure data-protection compliance and application access.

questions.question_text: What are three attributes monitored by the Panorama AWS plugin? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
There are four correct answers; B, C, D, and E.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/vm-series/11-1/vm-series-deployment/set-up-the-vm-series-firewall-on-aws/list-of-attributes-monitored-on-the-aws-vpc

Selected Answer: BCD
The correct answers would be B, C, D & E.
The four attributes are monitored by Panorama AWS Pluging
C is Also a correct answer as per the link provided.
